channel.title: The Hon. Luis Fortuño
channel.description: The Hon. Luis Fortuño Governor of Puerto Rico (Remarks as Prepared for Delivery)

item.title: Thank you.
item.author: The Hon. Luis Fortuño

item.title: Buenas noches Puerto Rico!
item.author: The Hon. Luis Fortuño

item.title: Buenas noches America!
item.author: The Hon. Luis Fortuño

item.title: As a proud American serving the nearly 4 million American citizens of Puerto Rico, I am honored to be with you tonight.
item.author: The Hon. Luis Fortuño

item.title: We gather to celebrate the hopes and dreams of every American. We all believe in the greatness of this nation, and this greatness lies within each of us.
item.author: The Hon. Luis Fortuño

item.title: Hard-working Americans are fighting every day to provide for themselves and their families, and to leave a more prosperous country for the next generation.
item.author: The Hon. Luis Fortuño

item.title: That's true here in Florida, it's true in Puerto Rico, and it's true throughout this great land of ours.
item.author: The Hon. Luis Fortuño

item.title: But, as families have tightened their budgets, Washington continues its wasteful spending.
item.author: The Hon. Luis Fortuño

item.title: Unless we elect leaders who take responsibility now, our children and theirs will pay for it later.
item.author: The Hon. Luis Fortuño

item.title: You and I know there is a better way, and like many conservative governors around the country, we are proving it.
item.author: The Hon. Luis Fortuño

item.title: When I took office, I inherited a $3.3 billion budget deficit, per person the largest anywhere in the nation.
item.author: The Hon. Luis Fortuño

item.title: We couldn't even meet our payroll. We were on the brink of bankruptcy.
item.author: The Hon. Luis Fortuño

item.title: But we did not shy away from our responsibility to lead. We cut government expenses by almost 20 percent, starting with my own salary.
item.author: The Hon. Luis Fortuño

item.title: We reduced our deficit 90 percent, while continuing to invest in our schools, hospitals, and highways.
item.author: The Hon. Luis Fortuño

item.title: At the same time, we slashed taxes 50 percent on individuals and 30 percent on businesses, the largest tax cuts in Puerto Rico's history.
item.author: The Hon. Luis Fortuño

item.title: And our private sector ­ the real economy ­ began to create jobs again. Imagine if we had national policies that support rather than prevent growth! We'd then be able to truly unleash the engine of prosperity that our country and our people deserve.
item.author: The Hon. Luis Fortuño

item.title: That's what Mitt Romney and Paul Ryan will do for America. They understand that each community's challenges are unique, but the answers are the same.
item.author: The Hon. Luis Fortuño

item.title: Our families cannot grow their budgets if politicians keep growing Washington's budget.
item.author: The Hon. Luis Fortuño

item.title: Get government out of our way, and let freedom and the spirit of the American people shine through.
item.author: The Hon. Luis Fortuño

item.title: We can out-think, out-dream, out-work, and out-produce anybody in the world.
item.author: The Hon. Luis Fortuño

item.title: I know it, you know it, and Mitt Romney and Paul Ryan know it.
item.author: The Hon. Luis Fortuño

item.title: They have a plan and a vision that places our faith in you, the American people, not in Washington.
item.author: The Hon. Luis Fortuño

item.title: Ask any small-business owner in America today -- from the dairy farmer in Appleton, Wisconsin, to the bodega owner in Kissimmee, Florida: they want to grow, to produce and to hire.
item.author: The Hon. Luis Fortuño

item.title: But they're concerned, worried that Washington will continue to punish them with more taxes, more red tape, and more government control.
item.author: The Hon. Luis Fortuño

item.title: Give them the freedom to grow, and you'll see how many jobs they create!
item.author: The Hon. Luis Fortuño

item.title: I like to talk a lot about freedom, because freedom is the essence of who we are as Americans.
item.author: The Hon. Luis Fortuño

item.title: Over 200,000 Puerto Ricans have served in uniform to defend our nation and the freedom we hold so dear.
item.author: The Hon. Luis Fortuño

item.title: Like in your home states, we raise and salute the American flag.
item.author: The Hon. Luis Fortuño

item.title: Just like our fellow citizens in Florida or Virginia, we share the same undying spirit that all Americans have. Allow me to share an example of that spirit.
item.author: The Hon. Luis Fortuño

item.title: I visited a soldier from Puerto Rico at Walter Reed Army Medical Center several years ago.
item.author: The Hon. Luis Fortuño

item.title: This young man had bravely served in combat and was given little chance to live.
item.author: The Hon. Luis Fortuño

item.title: Without knowing if he could hear me, in every visit, I would whisper into his ear.
item.author: The Hon. Luis Fortuño

item.title: I would tell him how proud and thankful we were for his dedication and sacrifice, adding, no te rindas: don't give up.
item.author: The Hon. Luis Fortuño

item.title: Months later, after his miraculous recovery, I had the honor of awarding him the Purple Heart.
item.author: The Hon. Luis Fortuño

item.title: He never gave up.
item.author: The Hon. Luis Fortuño

item.title: For him, and for every American in uniform, we will never give up.
item.author: The Hon. Luis Fortuño

item.title: For every mother who struggles, saves, and sacrifices so her children will have greater opportunities, we will never give up.
item.author: The Hon. Luis Fortuño

item.title: For every small-business owner who builds it to make a better life, we will never give up.
item.author: The Hon. Luis Fortuño

item.title: For Mitt Romney and Paul Ryan, who know what it takes to put America back to work and back on track, we will never give up.
item.author: The Hon. Luis Fortuño

item.title: And for the values that make America great: the justice that is our right, the freedom to unleash the greatness within each of us, and the liberty that God endowed every American.
item.author: The Hon. Luis Fortuño

item.title: For that, I will never give up, you will never give up, we will never give up!
item.author: The Hon. Luis Fortuño

item.title: God Bless you, and God bless the United States of America!
item.author: The Hon. Luis Fortuño

item.title: And muchas gracias, thank you, Puerto Rico ­ I'll be home tomorrow!
item.author: The Hon. Luis Fortuño
